page.title: 04Warburton Village
page.content: The original toll bridge was built over the{River Mersey}in 1866 to replace the{Warburton}to Hollins Green ferry. The old river bed is now used for farming, and all that remains of the river is a pond. You can still see the old toll house, which has been used as an antique shop, but is now deserted. The original bridge has been buried, and the new toll booth is for the cantilever bridge built over the {Manchester Ship Canal.}There is an old church in{Warburton}which is no longer used regularly for services. It can be dated back to 1200. Nearby can be seen the remains of a cross, and the walls leading down to the church are made from slabs of slate which look like gravestones.There are traces of Pre_ historic animals near to the old church.
